channel.title: Npc Cliping [317]
channel.description: [img]http://i.imgur.com/DYvywPI.png[/img] well the picture explains it all. the zombies can attack through walls and you can attack them back through walls, any help please :)

item.title: Npc Cliping [317]
item.dc:creator: @Death_Style Death Style
item.description:
@Death_Style wrote:

The code he posted implied that function was handling the NPC pathfinding.

[quote=“jSiK, post:9, topic:544249”]would i add it in this? still kinda learning

public void getNextNPCMovement(int i) {
direction = -1;
if(Server.npcHandler.npcs[i].freezeTimer == 0) {
direction = getNextWalkingDirection();
}
}[/quote]

Probably a misinterpretation like I’ve said earlier, but I’m sure whatever function that pathfinds NPCs would be entirely relevant. You would check if an NPC could pathfind to its target’s tile and only allow it to attack if the next tile in the path is that tile.

Sorry if I wasn’t clear; this seemed pretty obvious.

Read full topic

item.title: Npc Cliping [317]
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Death Style, post:20, topic:544249”][quote author=asshole_rule link=topic=663129.msg4432169#msg4432169 date=1403713201]

I guess I misinterpreted that function, assuming it was calculating where the NPC was walking to.

Lol but you don’t understand that the NPC walking has nothing to do with the problem
[/quote]
An NPC being unable to walk to a tile usually indicates it can’t attack something on that tile.

Maybe that’s too abstract for you.[/quote]

you’ve just proven to me that you are retarded.

getNextWalkingDirection

Does that even sound remotely close to anything related to clipped npc combat? The problem is he’s not checking if there is an object infront of the npc inside of the whatever method handles npc attacking. Walking direction has NOTHING to do with that.

Read full topic

item.title: Npc Cliping [317]
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

Death Style:

I’d still look in getNextWalkingDirection()

the walking direction has absolutely nothing to do with the fact that Zombies can attack him even while the path is supposed to be blocked. So, no, you’re wrong.

[quote=“ohokay, post:11, topic:544249”][quote author=ohokay link=topic=663129.msg4431864#msg4431864 date=1403578562]
If you already have a version of clipping in your server, you need methods to check if the current attacking path is blocked between you and the entity you’re attacking. This will solve the basic problems of attacking through objects.
[/quote][/quote]

Do this ^

It should be fairly easy aslong as you already have some type of clipping system implemented already

Read full topic

item.title: Npc Cliping [317]
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

ohokay:

If you already have a version of clipping in your server, you need methods to check if the current attacking path is blocked between you and the entity you’re attacking. This will solve the basic problems of attacking through objects.

Read full topic

item.title: Npc Cliping [317]
item.dc:creator: @Death_Style Death Style

@Death_Style wrote:

I’d check the NPC files to see whatever function checks if they can travel somewhere, then just define it so it also checks during combat. You’ll have to make exceptions for ranging and certain obstacles.

item.title: Npc Cliping [317]
item.dc:creator: @Death_Style Death Style
item.description:
@Death_Style wrote:

Maybe your server has clipping measures and it’s not being applied to NPCs. No way to know from my pov.

I’m guessing there are a bunch of other related problems to be found. If someone had a modified client and spawned a ladder they could most likely use it anywhere since your server is only handling the interactions and not checking if the objects are actually there.

Read full topic
